The Valence Saber communicates via Bluetooth LE with your 
Android™* smartphone for instant color and sound change. Control up to 7
 sabers at the same time on one device. The free Valence Saber App 
allows you to preview color and sound on your phone before you make the 
changes to your saber. You can even turn off individual sound effects 
and adjust the volume. Best of all you can effortlessly turn your saber 
on and off with one press. 
*Android is a trademark of Google Inc.

What if I don't have/want to use my phone?Good
 news! The Valence Saber's suite of effects are also available directly 
on the saber. Highly specific motions allow color and sound change; 
these motions are designed to be purposeful and time sensitive so your 
saber has the best chance of keeping the setting you want. And the saber
 already turns on and off without the phone, so no worries there.





Blades
Each saber's blade is 1.25" outside diameter, approximately 33.5" in length. The wall is 1/16" wide, allowing the blade to be durable yet light enough for extensive dueling. The LED strips are housed in the blade, which is removable, along with the diffusing foam and 3M diffuser film. Tested by slamming into concrete. Results: no discernible damage, no broken LEDs. These blades can take punishment. See OUR PROMISE section for warranty.

Valence Sheath™
The Valence Sheath is a revolutionary feature that completely 
changes the way you experience costume-ready, custom saber handles. Now 
with each Valence Saber you can quickly customize the entire cosmetic 
look and feel in seconds without the need to purchase additional sabers.


How it Works:

Back us now!: Pick your perk. When you back us for a Valence Saber you get the VS Echelon™ sheath at no additional cost! That's right, your first sheath is on us.
Super Simple Assembly: The sheath slides over the existing 
base handle and locks securely into place. A soft-tipped guide screw 
makes sure the speaker slots and USB slot line up and stay that way. 
Screw is permanently attached during manufacturing so no tools are 
required for the sheath, either. To remove simply pull firmly on the 
sheath and it slides off.
Customize: Need to make a quick costume switch? No problem. 
The Valence Saber switches with you. Or maybe your character is in 
between the light and dark and switches sabers based on his or her mood?
 We've got you covered. As our sheath library grows you'll be able to 
choose from simplistic, minimalist designs to full-on movie ready 
wonders perfect for your costume!




The Valence Saber is so well built, so reliable that if at any time it breaks from normal use you can send it back for a one-time replacement. Just don't take a bath with it or call on the power of Thor - we can't cover silly or supernatural.*


*Lifetime warranty covers saber to saber contact only. One-time replacement Valence Saber is offered. No warranty is given on replacement saber. No damages, including water, electrical, physical, non-saber contact, etc., covered. No disassembly or assembly damage covered. "Dead" battery unit not covered





















Look, stuff happens. But we want you to know transparency and honesty are forefront in making the best product we can. That's why we hired an expert guide in our supply partner so we can rectify any unforeseen problems quickly and get you your saber as fast as possible. 

We've prototyped and everything fits, but that doesn't mean it will during production. And if it doesn't we'll have to go back and fix it, which takes time. Our greatest challenge is ensuring the saber you get is the saber we want you to get. If it takes longer than anticipated you'll be the first to know.



Beyond this you can rest easy knowing your Valence Saber will permanently occupy a warm place in your heart- figuratively speaking of course.
**Valence Saber, LLC and the Valence Saber™ are in no way affiliated with or endorsed by Lucasfilm ltd., Disney, or any of their subsidiaries, associates, employees, or licensed affiliates or agents. Images displayed on this campaign page are the original, sole property of Valence Saber, LLC and do not represent any copyrighted or trademarked material of the aforementioned parties. All other images that are not the original, sole property of Valence Saber, LLC are the property of their independent owners. Valence Saber, LLC will take all steps necessary to ensure that its property in no way confuses the audience with property copyrighted and trademarked by Lucas Film ltd. or Disney. Valence Saber, LLC makes no claim to own any of the copyrights or trademarks of Lucas Film ltd. or Disney and further claims no use of these copyrights or trademarks in content presented from Valence Saber, LLC.

story:
Our Mission and Values

Hello everybody! Our Mission is to encourage people to join the sustainable living movement by investing in high-quality home gym equipment made from Natural 100% Biodegradable, Recyclable & Vegan materials. Sustainability has been at the very core of this business idea since it's conception. It was very important to us to create a "Climate-Positive" (Or Carbon Negative) Company, that gives more back to the environment than what it takes away.  We want to make a genuine contribution to the betterment of the health of our planet and it's people. We will be implementing a Reforestation Initiative in which we plant one tree locally for every product sold and will be using zero plastic in our packaging.

The magnitude of what this innovative project aims to achieve is incredible: we want to make people re-think their unnecessarily destructive fitness habits and revert to natural bodyweight training methods using minimal calisthenics equipment. Exercise being something that a large percentage of our population does on a near-daily basis, this project has the potential to have a huge impact on carbon emission reductions and our health.

 

 

 

About Me


I graduated from a BA in International Business with Spanish from DCU and have worked in 2 start-up companies since graduating: a Spanish Fashion company called Micolet, in which I worked as a Digital Marketing specialist, and a new brand of Irish whiskey in the US called The Fighting 69th Irish whiskey, where I worked as a Brand Ambassador. From these positions I have gained invaluable insights and experience in launching a start-up. Furthermore, Fitness and Sustainability have always been a passion of mine.

 

Initial Costs


 

According to our initial sales projections, we are going to need 200 units of wooden pushup bars, 150 units of the sustainable cork yoga mats and 150 units of the sets of latex long loop resistance bands.

I am crowdfunding this project to raise the additional capital I need to get this business idea off the ground. The total needed from this point onwards to start this company is just over €10K. I have already invested over €3k of my personal savings to this point, and will be raising about €2K from local investors, but I do not have enough capital to pay my suppliers for the number of products I want to begin with. This is why we are aiming to crowdfund an additional €12K, and why I have decided to offer pre-sales through IndieGoGo. 

So far, the money has gone into getting samples of the different products we want to sell shipped to Ireland from our suppliers. We got 4/5 of each product delivered from different suppliers, and are currently working on testing the different samples we have gotten both ourselves and with local Personal Trainers, Yoga Instructors and Gym Owners to get their opinions. We have also used the money for test marketing online through Google PPC ads and SurveyMonkey targeted surveys. Some has also been used on GSuite, SurveyMonkey and HootSuite memberships. The rest has gone into the development of our logo, website and Social Media Pages, all with the help of professionals. 


Challenges

A large challenge initially for our company will be distribution. Initially, I am going to handle it from home and give my personal mobile number as the contact number. This will give me the chance to build a FAQ for our website and to work out any initial kinks with packaging and delivery costs both nationally and internationally. Once sales go above a certain number per week, I am going to outsource distribution to a logistics partner in Ireland.
I will also outsource help with Digital Marketing.

 

So, why should YOU fund this project?

As a funder, you have a real opportunity here to make a contribution to the betterment of the health of our planet and it's people. This project has huge potential to improve the lives and reduce the emissions of thousands of people, all the while planting trees and contributing to a better future on our planet for our grandchildren. Wouldn't you love to tell your friends and family that you were part of something like that?

Without funding, TrainPURE Fitness will not be able to progress through these difficult initial stages, and the world will have missed out on a brand that has the potential to have a huge positive impact in our lives. 10 years from now, we could have hundreds of thousands, if not millions, of new trees planted in forests in Ireland and across the world, and have saved an unfathomable amount of carbon emissions from people deciding to think sustainably and train at home. Think of all this potential that could go to waste if we never have the chance to get up and running. Consider this funding a pre-purchase, as you will be receiving one (or more) of our first products as soon as they arrive with us.

I would hugely appreciate it if you could get the word out as much as you can about our project on your own Social Media, websites or whatever other promotional mediums you may have. In these initial stages, every little helps a lot!


Thank you for taking the time out of your day to read this project. I really appreciate it and I would love to hear your thoughts about it. Feel free to get in touch if you have any further questions.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

While working in a heavy industries as engineer for over 20 years, I myself have suffered from backpain occasionally. Especially, since my home is located far from the company, driving a car was like hell when the backpain attacks. The main purposes of this campaign are to help slipped disk patients live and work more comfortably and promote widespread use of our waist crutch. What we would want from contributors is to donate 70 US dollars or more until the total amount reaches 7,000 dollars. In return we are planning to provide the product at the price of around 70 dollars each.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we aim at is 7,000 dollars and will be used to expand our business  worldwide. We plan to initially manufacture 100 waist crutches and distribute them to the contributors at about 70 dollars each, half as much as the list price. We intend to return the money to the investors if the funds collected fall short of the target amount, $7,000.

 

The Impact

The trends of global aging and increasing sedentary(sitting) working environments lead to a sharp increase in the number of slipped disk patients. Many of the patients, however, live an uncomfortable life after conservative treatment because the surgical approach is often ineffective. In Korea, the number of slipped disk patients reaches about 8% of the total population, or 4 million. Among them, more than 90% or 3.7 million people live after conservative treatment without surgery. The United States or other countries are assumed to have the same situation.

     Therefore, it is urgent to provide a working solution to those who suffer from back pain while sitting on a chair or floor at home or workplace, or while driving on a car seat for a long time. The proposer of this project himself experienced a lot of pain in his back while driving long hours, which eventually led to the development of this product. As a first step, five sets of the prototype were made and put to field test successfully. In the process of field test, we could ensure ourselves great demands of our back support device. Also, the volunteer users have encouraged and advised us to help other sufferers live in peace. For example, we received a thank-you letter from a fifteen-year-old girl  who had been able to study at a desk with the help of our waist chair. She used to suffer from the deformed spine caused by severe slipped disk for a long time.

Risks & Challenges

We expect that there may be a couple of roadblocks: First the design of the product could be improved in its completeness. This causes the product to be less marketable or of less commercial value. Second, it is quite possible that outstanding success in the market will touch off a surge of copycat products because the design of our product is rather simple. The  countermeasures are two-fold: Once sufficient funds are available, a team of design experts can be ready to keep improving the marketability and completeness of the product through quality upgrades. Furthermore, as of now, we have registered a domestic patent for our waist crutch, and filed an international patent application under the PCT. We will continue to file patent applications in more countries possible. We believe these two measures should be effective in maximizing the product quality and fighting against the would-be copycats.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can't participate in our campaign, they may visit our Web page (in Korean) or Youtube to see and evaluate our product for their needs. We hope the news of our waist crutch can reach all those with disk or back problems.

  • Web page: http://www.lazback.com (Korean)
  • Youtube: (long version) https://youtu.be/Au4H9gbEnqM (English)

                           (short version) https://youtu.be/LMPScdfTE_I (English)

story:
Overview of Health Sherlock

My Dream: Max Narovlyansky

I am Max, founder and CEO of FlowCell. I am a Ph.D. in Biochemistry from Harvard Univ. and was a Postdoc at Baylor Univ. I worked in different senior roles at Abbott and Instrumentation Laboratory. I was the Director of Assay development in cancer and biomarker research. Finally started my own Company, FlowCell.

If FlowCell was my dream, Health Sherlock is my commitment to the society. I feel it is our collective responsibility to raise the importance of rare diseases and rare cancers with everyone, researchers and Pharma industry alike. We should put an effort in bringing them on an Open integrated platform to democratize the healthcare for rare diseases/cancers, and connect patients with health care experts for differential diagnosis and improve their quality of life.

Health Sherlock is a consumer-oriented platform with a mission to let patients take charge of their own health by providing a repository of actionable information.

  • We will allow users to engage with others dealing with the same illness in a safe and secure environment. 
  • We will help users learn of which diagnostics and treatments worked for people with similar conditions.
  • Health Sherlock will help you and your doctor reap the benefits of crowdsourced knowledge of rare conditions, and the latest in diagnostics and treatments. 

Over time, Health Sherlock hopes to help health providers access essential information for the development of future diagnostics and research. 

Our Mission

We are building a data repository and search engine to empower patients to take control of their healthcare, their data and take informed decisions. Unifying a database for individuals with a rare disease is our priority as we aim to provide personal data depending on the patient's unique biomarkers.

Our Vision 

The key to our vision is privacy for healthcare data and free access for patients. We are developing a system for automated analysis of clinical trials using AI, Natural Language Processing, and will apply this tool for scientific publications create awareness

 

See it in action!

Health Sherlock features

The Problem & Our Solution

While underestimating the severity of rare diseases, rare diseases continue to have devastating impacts on peoples' lives across the world.

  • Rare diseases are often overlooked because of their label of being "rare" but more than 400 million people globally are affected by rare diseases.
  • Children are especially vulnerable to rare diseases - Children under the ages of 5 have a mortality rate of 30%.
    • In fact, 50% of all people affected by rare diseases are children. 
  • Most rare diseases lack proper treatment resulting in limited therapy options even after diagnosis. 

Meet Our Team

Special thanks to 

Challenges

Health Sherlock is a community-driven project with the aim of bringing awareness to rare diseases and addressing the needs of patients suffering from these diseases and conditions. Health Sherlock heavily relies on the contributions and inputs of users in order to meet these goals, therefore Health Sherlock requires everyone to understand the severity of rare diseases and bring light to both rare diseases and Health Sherlock. 

How can you help? Join Us! 

Together we can help with the earlier discovery of rare diseases and connect all people with the help that they all need and deserve.

Follow Us!

How can you help? Join Us! Together we can help with the earlier discovery of rare diseases and connect all people with the help that they all need and deserve.Follow Us!

story: Im young and ambitious. Im looking for help to get back on my feet and get the ball rolling again, finally.
story_txt: Im young and ambitious. Im looking for help to get back on my feet and get the ball rolling again, finally.

story:
For a quick overview, check out the video above!

 

What's the problem?

All around us, there are individuals who require priority seating but do not have an obvious way to communicate this to the immediate public, like a cane, a cast or crutches. This is referred to as an invisible disability or condition.

Communicating the need for a seat is not always possible, and is never easy.

  • By asking someone for their seat, you make an assumption that they are healthy and able to stand.
  • By offering your seat to someone, you make an assumption about their condition and need.

 

Why is this important?

Personal experience with back pain has illuminated specific challenges in utilizing public spaces.

For me, and for many individuals with invisible illnesses, injuries, or conditions, a lack of guaranteed seating in public spaces means: 

  • Increased costs:

Individuals must pay for car-related (i.e. parking), or ride-share/cab costs, if public transportation is not an option due to lack of seating. This applies to transportation for any purpose, including commuting to work and getting to doctors’ appointments.

A reserved seat must be purchased when attending a concert or performance, often at a higher cost, rather than taking a chance with open/general seating (lower cost).

 

  • Missed career opportunities: 

If a commute to a job requires use of public transportation, due to cost-prohibitive or limited parking options, that job cannot be pursued by an individual who needs a seat. In effect, this makes many urban areas off-limits to a large group of professionals.

Networking events often require long periods of standing, and are inaccessible to many individuals with invisible conditions.

 

  • Limited social engagement/wellness: 

Social events in public places often do not guarantee seating. Individuals can try to pre-arrange seating, but this is not always possible. Many times, an event must be avoided, and the individual misses out on an important occasion with family, friends or colleagues.

 

Guaranteed seating would alleviate these challenges, among others, and open doors to public spaces for many individuals.

 

What does Seated do?

Seated alerts an individual that someone nearby requires priority seating, and allows that person to volunteer a seat. Mobile technology allows us to bypass assumptions and make requests clear and discreet, in real time. A mobile app, like Seated, puts control directly into the hands of an individual who needs help, and opens up a simple, direct line of communication with the immediate public who are willing and able to help.

Seated guarantees seating in public spaces by connecting an individual with a volunteer willing to offer a seat, while lowering barriers to asking for help.

 

How does Seated work?

Install the app on your personal device.

Select your role:

  • VIP - you need a seat

OR

  • Volunteer - you are willing and able to give up your seat 

 

The VIP activates Seated when in a public place where seating is limited. 

Seated searches for Volunteers nearby.

The Volunteer receives an alert that a VIP is nearby and needs a seat. 

The Volunteer offers a seat to the VIP, or ignores the request.

The VIP receives an alert that a Volunteer is offering a seat.

The VIP  accepts or declines the offer.

If the request is accepted by both parties, the Volunteer offers the seat to the designated VIP.  No further exchange of information is needed.

*Note: An individual can easily switch between VIP or Volunteer roles. For example, after an injury, someone regularly willing and able to volunteer a seat (Volunteer role) may require seating (VIP role). After recovery, a VIP can switch back to being a Volunteer.

 

Who benefits?

  • Injury
  • Illness (acute)
  • Illness (chronic)
  • Pregnancy
  • Adult accompanying a child that needs to be carried
  • Elderly
  • Low vision
  • Intellectual disability
  • Psychiatric disability
  • And more…

 

Where can Seated be used?

  • Trains
  • Buses
  • Music/comedy/performance venues
  • Waiting rooms (i.e. pharmacy)
  • Public forums/meetings
  • Coffee shops
  • Bars
  • Any public place where seating is not guaranteed

 

Why now?

I’ve been thinking about this problem for a long time. And now we’re in an era where we use our mobile devices to connect with others for transportation, lodging, dating, commerce, and many other important functions. Seated extends this movement of collaboration and shared resources, and brings it to a community who can truly benefit in important ways from the awareness and generosity of others.

Seated is a simple, low-cost solution that can serve a wide range of conditions and populations.

When I ride the train, or attend a concert, I scan the crowd in hopes of finding a seat, allowing me to comfortably get to my destination, or to stay for the entire show. I believe that the people around me are good and would gladly assist me if they are able, but I don't have an easy way to access them without making assumptions and overtly exposing my own condition. Seated gives us a tool to help each other out, when we can.

 

Contribute

If you believe there is a need for Seated, and would like to see it move forward, consider donating, and sharing this campaign. Your contribution to this campaign will go toward:

PHASE I:

  • gauge interest 
  • create/test a prototype of the app
  • business development*

*I hope to keep Seated free for all users. This will be a main focus of business development in Phase I.

With enough interest and a proof-of-concept in hand, funding will then be sought for:

PHASE II:

  • build and market a scalable app (the real thing!)

 

Thank you for your support!

Together we can make public spaces more accessible for everyone.

 

To learn more, check out these resources:

The Invisible Disabilities Association

National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS)

Transport for London (TfL) Badge Program

story:
It's about time. That Grand Traverse County gets a state-of-the-art indoor rock climbing and alternative fitness center! MI Summit Climbing will be an eco-friendly climbing center that will have tall verticle walls, large bouldering area, yoga/community room, and much more. This is the climbing and alternative fitness center that you've been waiting for.

MI Summit was created by a group of passionate rock climbers, local business owners, and educators looking to bring a brand new indoor climbing center to the Greater Michigan Area. The land has already been purchased, building plans finalized, all we need now is the backing of supports like you to secure the funding to construct the building and climbing walls. MI Summit is ready to take your climbing to the next level!

 

Help us realize our dream of bringing MI Summit to life by pre-ordering your climbing pass today! Save over 50% when you claim the Early Bird Founders Pass. 

Our team is ready to bring MI Summit to life! We are crazy about rock climbing and have been climbing in the area for decades. After many years of not having a climbing center to call home, we have formed a rock star team that can bring this dream to reality.

story:
How it works

For example, you want us to create an app for basketball.

We will immediately launch Kaki Basketball live on Google Play and App Store, and the app will allow you to find buddies with the same interest (living near you)!

Kaki Buddy

Just to prove we can deliver, we have launched a prototype of what your app will be like on Google Play and App store called Kaki Buddy. (Kaki Buddy was mentioned in Singapore's #1 newspaper, The Straits Times) 

Please note that this app is only a prototype of what your Kaki Sport app will be like, and once we are funded, we will release fully functional apps that are better, faster, smoother and much sleeker according to the sports/activities you have chosen.

Hard work isn't an issue for my team, and we will work day and night to create apps that are smooth, user-friendly and bug-free for our wonderful backers!

An example of what your app will look like

         

1) Create your profile

2) Create or join a team/group

    3) Chat with your new Kakis!

    4) You can challenge other teams too

    The power of Kaki Apps

    Challenging other groups/teams really shines in activities that require larger teams or groups, since you can easily challenge another team to a match with 1 single swipe!

    For example, instead of needing to find another 11 people to play a full soccer match (which can be alot of work, calling friends & finding a common time for all), you just need to challenge another team, and let their leader deal with his team members!

    This can also be useful for smaller groups; for example you and your spouse love badminton, but your friends aren't that passionate about it. Just use this app to find another couple nearby with the same interest and you're good to go!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Get the word out and make some noise about Kaki Apps!

    More people knowing about this = more users and potential buddies on the apps!

    Unfortunately, if we cannot hit our goal of $15,000, all the money will be refunded to all backers and Kaki Apps may never see the light of day. Share our campaign to prevent this tragedy!

    FAQ

    Q: Why Kaki Apps? Why not just use Meetup or join a Facebook group?

    A: After trying these (and many other) apps we have found them all troublesome & tedious for a task that should be simple: find people with the same interest living near you. With Kaki, we combined 2 apps (Tinder + Whatsapp) which do exactly what they are supposed to do. Except instead of finding people for romantic reasons, you find people with the same activity interest as you. Also, Kaki allows group to group interaction (so your soccer team can challenge another soccer team easily). And with a much more personalized touch, your group will now consist of people who live a stone's throw away from you!

    Q: What if I want to find people who are beginners (or experts) at the sport?

    A: We have the option to select this in the app.

    Q: What will the app be called after it is published?

    A: It will be Kaki "Activity name". For example, Kaki Basketball.

    Q: For the "Create a Team" Perk, will I be able to modify my group/team details after you create it for me?

    A: Yes, creating & editing a team/group on Kaki App is amazingly simple! We just do it for you so that your team/group will look amazing and you will save the effort of finding a beautiful team image or writing a team description to attract others to join your team.

    Q: Will I, as a backer, own rights to the app with the activity I choose? For example, if i choose basketball and Kaki Basketball is launched, will I be the owner of the app?

    A: Unfortunately, no. We are creating the app for backers who really want to use a Kaki app (to find their Kakis/buddies with the same interests living near them). This crowdfunding campaign is not profit-driven; all proceeds from the campaign will go towards funding development of the apps.

    Kaki Apps: Your favourite sport or activity, anytime & anywhere

    Have something else you want? Message us with your suggested perk and we will add it to our list of perks as long as we are able to deliver!

Kaki Apps: Your favourite sport or activity, anytime & anywhere
Have something else you want? Message us with your suggested perk and we will add it to our list of perks as long as we are able to deliver!

story:
The Big Picture

MedKaz is like insurance. There when you need it. You simply give your MedKaz — which contains ALL your records from ALL your current and past providers — to your doctor. Reduces risk. Saves you money. Ensures you receive quality care at home, away, in an emergency.

Does what NONE of your doctors' portals can do. Assembles ALL your records from ALL your care providers in one place and contains DETAILED notes not merely summaries!

Anyone can use it even if you have limited computer skills or are unable to afford a smartphone. 

Everyone benefits today, tomorrow. Doctors can coordinate/deliver better care. Patients receive better care; save money. Payers — employers, insurers and government — save money. Our economy is stronger. Paves the way for major changes in the way care is organized, delivered, and paid for.

 

When You Need It

Travel   You get sick away from home.

  • You see a doctor but he or she knows nothing about your medical issues or history and can't access your records. If you're healthy, this may not be a problem.
  • If you have chronic illnesses, it is a big problem.
  • In either case, MedKaz solves it.

Emergency   Whether at home or away, you're rushed to an Emergency Department.

  • They, too, know nothing about you or your medical history. They may draw blood to learn something about the state of your health, and they treat you as best they can.
  • If you're unconscious, their problems treating you are compounded.
  • In either case, MedKaz solves the problem.

Routine Care   Your current doctors each have only their own records to guide them.

  • Unless they are all in the same network, they can't access all your records from all your other current and past providers.
  • Even if they have treated you for years, they often need to access your previous providers' records to gain insight into your current issues, but they may not be available. This frequently results in extra visits, your doctor ordering unnecessary tests and procedures, and may result in costly mistakes.
  • MedKaz solves the problem.

 

How Your Doctors Use It

 

What People Say

MB, Vermont, patient   "I have all my records for the last 35 years on my MedKaz. My doctors and I love it. I recently avoided two office visits and related procedures because the information my doctors needed was on my MedKaz. This saved Medicare almost $900. Not a bad return on a $99 investment." (NB, it's only $59 during this campaign!)

DL, New York, patient   "I developed severe chest pains and was rushed by ambulance to a hospital Emergency Department. They saw I previously had open heart surgery and asked me what vessels were involved. I didn't know so they assigned a resident to get my records from the hospital where my surgery had been performed. They exchanged a lot of faxes including a HIPAA release for me to sign, and finally faxed my records to the resident. This process took an agonizing 45 minutes. I was afraid I'd die before they would treat me. If I had had a MedKaz, both the delay and stress I felt would have been avoided!"

JB, Ohio, patient   For 20 years I suffered from an illness none of my doctors could identify. They put me through hell; even psychiatric treatment. Finally, one doctor got my records from all of them and diagnosed my problem. I had — and still have – Lupus. If any of my other doctors had access to all my records, they too could have diagnosed my problem but assembling all of them was too hard. If I had had a MedKaz, at least one of them could have diagnosed my problem years earlier and saved me the pain, suffering, emotional distress and costs I incurred!

AB, New England, Chief Medical Information Officer, major teaching hospital   “[MedKaz] gives the patient real power in accumulating their record from any location they receive care. It is a simple, inexpensive, and straightforward solution to a complex problem.”

RM, Ohio, patient parent   “I love the idea of the MedKaz! Not only do I plan on using one for my son, but I am in the process of loading information for my father…. I see it becoming a very important tool to use as we progress into a world where we need to be our own advocate when it comes to our healthcare.”

PA, Orthopedic Surgery, New Hampshire, teaching hospital   “Just learned about MedKaz. What a great product. It would be extremely helpful if each of our patients had one.”

 

Unique Features

Six adjectives describe the wonders of MedKaz: Convenient. Secure. Powerful. Enabling. Financially sound. 

Convenient   All your records are in one place — your pocket.

  • They're complete, not summaries.
  • No delays; there when you or your doctors need them. Updated for you.
  • Easy to use, no special training required. If you can log onto a computer and perform a search, you can use MedKaz.
  • Affordable and useable by all, including the 57 million seniors and low income earners who are among our heaviest healthcare users but don’t have smartphones. 

Secure   Most secure system available. 

  • HIPAA compliant. Encrypted. Password-controlled to two levels.
  • Your records aren't stored on someone else's server. We erase them from our Server when you, your doctors, family or other's you designate have downloaded them.

Powerful   Manages all records. Instantly searchable.

  • Handles all records regardless of how they were created or formatted, whether electronic or paper. 
  • Search terms are highlighted for instant access.
  • Records can be shared with your doctors, family members, care givers and researchers as documents or structured data.
  • Works during power and Internet outages, and natural disasters. 

Enabling   You own it. It moves with you, gives you peace of mind. 

  • Enables you to understand your issues, recall what your provider told you, know what you’re supposed to do.
  • You can correct mistakes; lock individual records for privacy.
  • Enables your doctors to understand your issues, history and care from all your doctors, coordinate your care, avoid errors and unnecessary visits, tests, procedures. 

Financially sound   Self-financing, Incentivizes everyone.

  • Patient subscribes to MedKaz Update & Support Service. Patient or payer (employer, insurer, government) pays. 
  • Patients save deductibles, copays.
  • Payers enjoy lower health insurance costs — ROI can be extraordinary.
  • Providers enjoy new income (we pay them to upload your records to our Server).

 

How MedKaz Compares

 

Our Campaign Goals

For ten years government mandates regarding medical records have created major barriers to innovations like MedKaz. But doctors, hospitals, patients, legislators — and now frustrated employers — are no longer willing to tolerate continuing delays. They demand better care and lower costs now, and are open to new solutions. 

We want to seize this moment, and ask your help. We have three goals: 

  • First, to inform the world MedKaz exists and provides today what people desperately want: patients want to control their records; care providers want to coordinate their patients' care; payers want to reduce today's high health insurance costs!
  • Second, to finance a major marketing initiative introducing MedKaz to consumers/patients, physicians, hospitals, and employers. We'll recruit a number of doctors, hospitals and employers to pilot MedKaz with their patients. 
  • Third, to continue developing new MedKaz features that meet changing needs. 

This program will cost $200,000 and will be paid for by contributions (we are not selling stock). In return for your contribution you will receive a reward of your choice.

  • You may subscribe to MedKaz at a 40% discount — for yourself or two, three or four family members.
  • If you opt to contribute a lesser amount, you may receive one or two smartphone popup stands. 
  • If you don't contribute, you can still help by telling your friends about MedKaz. Email them. TXT them. Post on Facebook or other social media, and refer them to this Indiegogo site. You'll be doing them a favor, helping to improve healthcare, and helping us achieve our goals!

If we raise less, we'll scale back but we'll proceed. (In either case, we'll raise additional capital in the near future to promote MedKaz more widely.)

 

Our Team  

Our Founder & CEO, Merle Bushkin, became interested in medical records following Hurricane Katrina. Like others, he saw patient records floating in water and read about people without prescriptions appearing at hospitals asking for red pills and blue pills. He asked why doctors kept paper records when every other industry was computerized.

As a senior citizen, successful investment banker, and graduate of Harvard College and Harvard Business School, he brought an “outsider” perspective to the problem. He assembled an extraordinary team of talented developers and advisors to solve it. Together, they formulated and built the groundbreaking MedKaz solution, and continue to add important features. 

Greg Rosensteel helped formulate and design the architectural structure for the MedKaz system and led its development and implementation. He previously founded a computer service company and worked at IBM’s Watson Research Center and Motorola. He graduated from Cornell with a degree in Computer Science. He recently joined another company and consults with us. Matt Casey, a very experienced developer and graduate of MIT, has assumed Greg's role. Byron Holcomb is the genius managing our back-end Server. He attended the University of Nebraska.

Other members of our outstanding technical team have degrees in computer science from leading universities, and have worked with technology leaders such as Google, Microsoft and InterSystems. Our highly skilled record processing team includes clinically trained PAs and nurses.  (Several people on this chart have been succeeded by others but the functions remain.)

 

 

Our Advisory Board includes highly respected senior clinicians and executives.

  • Michael Epstein, MD Formerly EVP and COO of Beth Israel Deaconness Medical Center in Boston, a teaching affiliate of Harvard Medical School, and previously COO and CMO of Boston's Children's Hospital.
  • James Reynolds President of Reynolds & Company, consultants to healthcare, insurance and educational organizations.
  • Kenneth Rossano Formerly a senior officer at Bank of Boston, a corporate director, trustee of McLean Hospital and Massachusetts Eye & Ear Infirmary and corporator of Partners Health Care System.
  • Joel Shelkrot, MD Formerly Medical Director of the Northeast PHO, an affiliate of Partners Healthcare and the Harvard Pilgrim Health Care Plan; previously President, The Medical Group, Beverly, MA.
  • The late Harold Hestnes, Esq. and Carl Sloane, were important advisors. Harold was senior partner at Wilmer Hale LLP and Chair of CareGroup, parent of Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center. Carl was Board Chair of Beth Israel Deaconess, a professor at Harvard Business School, and founder of Temple, Barker & Sloane, management consultants.

 

Technology Partners

             

                                                                             

Risks

We believe our patented MedKaz will succeed. It is superior to anything out there, meets everyone's needs today and will meet them tomorrow.

But healthcare is complex with many powerful entrenched players, including EMR vendors and government agencies. And now corporate giants new to healthcare, like Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway, JPMorgan Chase, Apple and Google, are entering the arena.

So it would be foolish to promise that we'll succeed. But we do promise that we'll scramble to gain adoption and put a MedKaz in everyone's pocket — yours, your family's and your friends'.

 

Time LineSpecifications

MedKaz®

     Size               1.67in x .5in x .19in, aluminum case; USB A, 2.0

     Memory       8GB (expandable to l28GB)

     Security       Encrypted; password controlled to two levels

      Patent         US Patent No. 8,180,654

Computers

     Systems       PCs - Windows XP, 7 or higher

                               Mac – 64-bit Intel processor, OS 10.5 or higher

     Browser        Chrome, Firefox 3.6 or later, Safari, Opera, Internet Explorer 8 or later,

     Resolution   Minimum 1024 x 768

     Hard Drive   100MB free disk space

     RAM               2GB or more

Internet       

     Broadband  fast as possible
story_txt:
The Big PictureMedKaz is like insurance. There when you need it. You simply give your MedKaz — which contains ALL your records from ALL your current and past providers — to your doctor. Reduces risk. Saves you money. Ensures you receive quality care at home, away, in an emergency.Does what NONE of your doctors' portals can do. Assembles ALL your records from ALL your care providers in one place and contains DETAILED notes not merely summaries!Anyone can use it even if you have limited computer skills or are unable to afford a smartphone. Everyone benefits today, tomorrow. Doctors can coordinate/deliver better care. Patients receive better care; save money. Payers — employers, insurers and government — save money. Our economy is stronger. Paves the way for major changes in the way care is organized, delivered, and paid for. When You Need ItTravel   You get sick away from home.
You see a doctor but he or she knows nothing about your medical issues or history and can't access your records. If you're healthy, this may not be a problem.
If you have chronic illnesses, it is a big problem.
In either case, MedKaz solves it.
Emergency   Whether at home or away, you're rushed to an Emergency Department.
They, too, know nothing about you or your medical history. They may draw blood to learn something about the state of your health, and they treat you as best they can.
If you're unconscious, their problems treating you are compounded.
In either case, MedKaz solves the problem.
Routine Care   Your current doctors each have only their own records to guide them.
Unless they are all in the same network, they can't access all your records from all your other current and past providers.
Even if they have treated you for years, they often need to access your previous providers' records to gain insight into your current issues, but they may not be available. This frequently results in extra visits, your doctor ordering unnecessary tests and procedures, and may result in costly mistakes.
MedKaz solves the problem.
 How Your Doctors Use It What People SayMB, Vermont, patient   "I have all my records for the last 35 years on my MedKaz. My doctors and I love it. I recently avoided two office visits and related procedures because the information my doctors needed was on my MedKaz. This saved Medicare almost $900. Not a bad return on a $99 investment." (NB, it's only $59 during this campaign!)DL, New York, patient   "I developed severe chest pains and was rushed by ambulance to a hospital Emergency Department. They saw I previously had open heart surgery and asked me what vessels were involved. I didn't know so they assigned a resident to get my records from the hospital where my surgery had been performed. They exchanged a lot of faxes including a HIPAA release for me to sign, and finally faxed my records to the resident. This process took an agonizing 45 minutes. I was afraid I'd die before they would treat me. If I had had a MedKaz, both the delay and stress I felt would have been avoided!"JB, Ohio, patient   For 20 years I suffered from an illness none of my doctors could identify. They put me through hell; even psychiatric treatment. Finally, one doctor got my records from all of them and diagnosed my problem. I had — and still have – Lupus. If any of my other doctors had access to all my records, they too could have diagnosed my problem but assembling all of them was too hard. If I had had a MedKaz, at least one of them could have diagnosed my problem years earlier and saved me the pain, suffering, emotional distress and costs I incurred!AB, New England, Chief Medical Information Officer, major teaching hospital   “[MedKaz] gives the patient real power in accumulating their record from any location they receive care. It is a simple, inexpensive, and straightforward solution to a complex problem.”RM, Ohio, patient parent   “I love the idea of the MedKaz! Not only do I plan on using one for my son, but I am in the process of loading information for my father…. I see it becoming a very important tool to use as we progress into a world where we need to be our own advocate when it comes to our healthcare.”PA, Orthopedic Surgery, New Hampshire, teaching hospital   “Just learned about MedKaz. What a great product. It would be extremely helpful if each of our patients had one.” Unique FeaturesSix adjectives describe the wonders of MedKaz: Convenient. Secure. Powerful. Enabling. Financially sound. Convenient   All your records are in one place — your pocket.
They're complete, not summaries.
No delays; there when you or your doctors need them. Updated for you.
Easy to use, no special training required. If you can log onto a computer and perform a search, you can use MedKaz.
Affordable and useable by all, including the 57 million seniors and low income earners who are among our heaviest healthcare users but don’t have smartphones. 
Secure   Most secure system available. 
HIPAA compliant. Encrypted. Password-controlled to two levels.
Your records aren't stored on someone else's server. We erase them from our Server when you, your doctors, family or other's you designate have downloaded them.
Powerful   Manages all records. Instantly searchable.
Handles all records regardless of how they were created or formatted, whether electronic or paper. 
Search terms are highlighted for instant access.
Records can be shared with your doctors, family members, care givers and researchers as documents or structured data.
Works during power and Internet outages, and natural disasters. 
Enabling   You own it. It moves with you, gives you peace of mind. 
Enables you to understand your issues, recall what your provider told you, know what you’re supposed to do.
You can correct mistakes; lock individual records for privacy.
Enables your doctors to understand your issues, history and care from all your doctors, coordinate your care, avoid errors and unnecessary visits, tests, procedures. 
Financially sound   Self-financing, Incentivizes everyone.
Patient subscribes to MedKaz Update & Support Service. Patient or payer (employer, insurer, government) pays. 
Patients save deductibles, copays.
Payers enjoy lower health insurance costs — ROI can be extraordinary.
Providers enjoy new income (we pay them to upload your records to our Server).
 How MedKaz Compares Our Campaign GoalsFor ten years government mandates regarding medical records have created major barriers to innovations like MedKaz. But doctors, hospitals, patients, legislators — and now frustrated employers — are no longer willing to tolerate continuing delays. They demand better care and lower costs now, and are open to new solutions. We want to seize this moment, and ask your help. We have three goals: 
First, to inform the world MedKaz exists and provides today what people desperately want: patients want to control their records; care providers want to coordinate their patients' care; payers want to reduce today's high health insurance costs!
Second, to finance a major marketing initiative introducing MedKaz to consumers/patients, physicians, hospitals, and employers. We'll recruit a number of doctors, hospitals and employers to pilot MedKaz with their patients. 
Third, to continue developing new MedKaz features that meet changing needs. 
This program will cost $200,000 and will be paid for by contributions (we are not selling stock). In return for your contribution you will receive a reward of your choice.
You may subscribe to MedKaz at a 40% discount — for yourself or two, three or four family members.
If you opt to contribute a lesser amount, you may receive one or two smartphone popup stands. 
If you don't contribute, you can still help by telling your friends about MedKaz. Email them. TXT them. Post on Facebook or other social media, and refer them to this Indiegogo site. You'll be doing them a favor, helping to improve healthcare, and helping us achieve our goals!
If we raise less, we'll scale back but we'll proceed. (In either case, we'll raise additional capital in the near future to promote MedKaz more widely.) Our Team  Our Founder & CEO, Merle Bushkin, became interested in medical records following Hurricane Katrina. Like others, he saw patient records floating in water and read about people without prescriptions appearing at hospitals asking for red pills and blue pills. He asked why doctors kept paper records when every other industry was computerized.As a senior citizen, successful investment banker, and graduate of Harvard College and Harvard Business School, he brought an “outsider” perspective to the problem. He assembled an extraordinary team of talented developers and advisors to solve it. Together, they formulated and built the groundbreaking MedKaz solution, and continue to add important features. Greg Rosensteel helped formulate and design the architectural structure for the MedKaz system and led its development and implementation. He previously founded a computer service company and worked at IBM’s Watson Research Center and Motorola. He graduated from Cornell with a degree in Computer Science. He recently joined another company and consults with us. Matt Casey, a very experienced developer and graduate of MIT, has assumed Greg's role. Byron Holcomb is the genius managing our back-end Server. He attended the University of Nebraska.Other members of our outstanding technical team have degrees in computer science from leading universities, and have worked with technology leaders such as Google, Microsoft and InterSystems. Our highly skilled record processing team includes clinically trained PAs and nurses.  (Several people on this chart have been succeeded by others but the functions remain.)  Our Advisory Board includes highly respected senior clinicians and executives.

Michael Epstein, MD Formerly EVP and COO of Beth Israel Deaconness Medical Center in Boston, a teaching affiliate of Harvard Medical School, and previously COO and CMO of Boston's Children's Hospital.

James Reynolds President of Reynolds & Company, consultants to healthcare, insurance and educational organizations.

Kenneth Rossano Formerly a senior officer at Bank of Boston, a corporate director, trustee of McLean Hospital and Massachusetts Eye & Ear Infirmary and corporator of Partners Health Care System.

Joel Shelkrot, MD Formerly Medical Director of the Northeast PHO, an affiliate of Partners Healthcare and the Harvard Pilgrim Health Care Plan; previously President, The Medical Group, Beverly, MA.
The late Harold Hestnes, Esq. and Carl Sloane, were important advisors. Harold was senior partner at Wilmer Hale LLP and Chair of CareGroup, parent of Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center. Carl was Board Chair of Beth Israel Deaconess, a professor at Harvard Business School, and founder of Temple, Barker & Sloane, management consultants.
 Technology Partners             
                                                                             RisksWe believe our patented MedKaz will succeed. It is superior to anything out there, meets everyone's needs today and will meet them tomorrow.But healthcare is complex with many powerful entrenched players, including EMR vendors and government agencies. And now corporate giants new to healthcare, like Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway, JPMorgan Chase, Apple and Google, are entering the arena.So it would be foolish to promise that we'll succeed. But we do promise that we'll scramble to gain adoption and put a MedKaz in everyone's pocket — yours, your family's and your friends'. Time LineSpecificationsMedKaz®     Size               1.67in x .5in x .19in, aluminum case; USB A, 2.0     Memory       8GB (expandable to l28GB)     Security       Encrypted; password controlled to two levels      Patent         US Patent No. 8,180,654Computers     Systems       PCs - Windows XP, 7 or higher                               Mac – 64-bit Intel processor, OS 10.5 or higher     Browser        Chrome, Firefox 3.6 or later, Safari, Opera, Internet Explorer 8 or later,     Resolution   Minimum 1024 x 768     Hard Drive   100MB free disk space     RAM               2GB or moreInternet            Broadband  fast as possible

story:
One thing we all have learned in 2020, is that we should always take hygiene seriously. One little extra step we took to maintain personal hygiene, will make a big difference when it comes to health protection. From sanitize your hand, your phone, and any object you have contact with.

Yes, your phone might be dirtier than a toilet seat, it stores not only your data, all germs you touch with your hand will likely stay with your phone as well. And you can’t just wash it like your hand. Don’t let your phone become the breeding ground for germs.

About SaniPower

Instead of buying and carrying different devices, we created SaniPower for you. SaniPower can be your Phone Sanitizer, UV Sterilizer wand and Wireless charger. It’s portable and sturdy, you can use it at home, office or for travel. SaniPower keeps everything around you sanitized and your phone charged.

Features：

UV Light

We choose ultraviolet with wavelength 260-280nm. This is the sweet spot where the light is safe to human body, and still strong enough to kill bacteria. It can penetrate the cell membrane and nucleus of organisms effectively.

Analysis and test result from Detection center of microbiology shows that SaniPower is able to kill 99.99% of Escherichia coli, staphylococcus aureus and candida albicans in 20 minutes.

Use SaniPower to sanitizer small items as well.

*We don’t recommend use disposable masks repeatedly.

Handheld Sterilizer

Keep environmental hygiene is also important. Many objects you have contacted with are full of germs as well. SaniPower is able to detach the UV light from the station. You can use it to sanitizer hotel bed, door handle, car seat etc.

In Handheld mode, UV light will automatically off when flip over, prevent your eye from having direct contact with UV light

Wireless Charging

Let’s get two birds with one stone. While sanitizing your phone, you could also charge it wirelessly with SaniPower. The Station of SaniPower is a QI wireless charger, compatible with both 10W or 5W Power.

QI wireless charger’s energy efficiency is as high as 80%. With overcharge and overheat protection, you can safely charge it overnight.

 

Support charging with phone case on (Transmission distance 6mm). Smart identification, only smart phone can trigger charging. You can use it sanitizer items like keys without worry wasting energy.

Risk

We been in electronic business for a long time and have reliable manufacturer and fulfillment partner. We have designed and completed the making of all essential mould for SaniPower. After the campaign, or even during the campaign, we be able to start mass production and have ready product early July and ship them out. We will keep a transparent communication with our backers regarding the process and any issue might arise.

[Shipping Notice]

We plan to use DHL shipping services for fast and safe delivery.

For the countries below, extra fee will be charged in addition to the shipping fee.

(Fuel surcharge not included)

1. Conflict countries fee : $22(Republic of South Sudan, Niger, Libya, Mali, Burundi, Syria, Afghanistan, Yemen, Iraq which are the countries where civil war, war, and terrorism continues.)

2. Trade sanction countries fee : $44(The UN Security Council restricts or sanctions trade with certain countries. It occurs in the following countries : North Korea, Somalia, Syria, Eritrea, Yemen, Iraq, Iran, Central African Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo.)

3. RAS(Remote Areas Surcharge) : Add $27 per case - A post code/zip code that is difficult to serve; or a suburb/town that is distant, inaccessible or infrequently served.

(Fuel surcharge not included)

* DHL Website : https://www.dhl.com/us-en/home.html

 

 

※ C/S policy for defects in using
- Warranty period : 1 year from the receipt of the "Reward"("Perk")  
- Regulation : 1-for-1 exchange in case of product defects in normal use(A backer is responsible for all round-trip shipping charges.)
- No warranty : The product on expired warranty / If the product cannot be repaired or reproduced due to the user's intention or negligence even under warranty. 
- How to apply : It will be dealt with after your accurate explaining about defects.
- Customer center : E-mail) anybarosuper@gmail.com

 


※ Not recognized as defects except the above policy
- There may be difference in 0.1-0.3mm depending on measurement methods and processing. 
- Colors may look different depending on the screen.
- The flow marks the materials enter may appear during the injection process of synthetic resin.
- Do not roll and jump on the product.
- Do not throw the product or wipe it with chemical liquid like acetone

story:
SHIVE S is oil dispensing pen coming with heating pad. The pen consists of 3 parts which are applying head, body and oil container with capacity of 5ml, which carries the oil while heating. Temperature sensor on container allows you to heat the oil to an optimal temperature of 40°C/104°F.





It has been proven, that oil massaging can not only make hair grow faster, but also can promote growth of new hair by nourishing and stimulating hair follicles. This means that SHIVE S can help people with problems such as hair loss, dandruff and other bacterial issues. In our book, we will tell you which oils are the best and how to mix them to get the best results!




Oil container

Metal container with rubber o-ring for easy manipulation while heating the oil. Capacity of the container is more than 5ml of liquid. Minimum to fill is 2ml for temperature sensor to work.

Applying head

Applying head is made of metal which assures keeping the temperature.

Pushing the button allows the oil to flow through the nozzle and out.

Body

Inside of body is made of metal which also helps to keep desired temperature.

Featuring lock-on paths on each end.

Heating pad

Heating pad is an electrical unit that provides the heat for the oil in pen. You just plug it in, turn it on and you are ready to go. Temperature sensor on the oil container tells you, when to turn the pad off.



We will use raised funds for following

  • Prototype
  • Resources
  • Machinery work
  • Shipping
  • Advertisement

Inside SHIVE S box you will find

  • Oil container
  • Body
  • Applying head
  • Heating pad
  • SHIVE book with instructions and tips
  • Canvas pouch bag

Thank you for all the support and contributions. Be sure to share our campaign with friends on facebook or twitter! It's your turn now!



Based on amount raised, it will be decided if second round of campaign is going to be launched. All contributors will receive their rewards.


Both US and EU versions are available. Text us with your questions and special needs.

story:
“It's a pretty simple mechanism, but it’s one no other device has done.”

David Priest  

"There are 4 million babies born in the US every year, but what surprised us was that a million moms go back to work within two weeks of giving birth," Ostrovsky said. "Instead of being focused on inundating the parents with data, we're giving them the information they need when they need it so they can make decisions or feel better when can't be with their baby."

Stuart Tomlinson 


As Seen On


We’ve reinvented the baby monitor with working parents in mind. BabyBit is a small wearable sensor you snap onto your baby’s clothing. It connects through your caregiver’s smartphone and sends you updates and notifications throughout the day about the things you want to know.


BabyBit was designed with one goal...to give new parents the information they need throughout the day when they can't be with their baby.

We use notifications to let parents know when something they care about is happening. For example, when grandma picks up the baby from daycare mom gets a notification. We felt that telling mom every time the baby cries undercuts the caregiver and creates tension. Instead, mom sets the amount of time she wants to give the caregiver to attend to the baby and BabyBit only notifies her when that time is exceeded and she would want to get involved. 

We set up a series of these configurable notifications so parents can choose what is important and what should cut through the noise of the day. The BabyBit app gives you additional detail when you want it.


“It’s Tuesday at 2 PM, where’s my baby?  With BabyBit I know…”  Katie G.


"I run a daycare from my home. I come highly recommended in my area. It's not always an option for family and friends to watch your children...first time moms (I work for three of them) are nervous and I understand them wanting to take every precaution. This product is a good idea."  Emily B.





Our Story

Every parent has a story of a time they wish they knew what was happening with their baby.  Our personal experiences were part of what led us to develop BabyBit. Founder Brian recalls a time when a babysitter planted his children in front of the TV and spent the next four hours asleep in their guest bedroom.  Co-founder Jonathan’s wife once came home to find a strange baby in their home.  It turned out that her nanny had been leaving their infant unattended for 30 minutes each day so she could pick-up another baby and care for them both in Jonathan’s home.  In both of these cases, a technology like BabyBit would have notified the parent if the baby was crying for a long period of time, and that the caregiver was not in proximity. 

Every year one million moms return to work within two weeks of giving birth… With 9 children between us, the idea for BabyBit emerged when we started to think about the stress new parents face, especially new mothers, when they return to work – often much earlier than they would like.  We asked ourselves, if we can't wave a wand and create more family friendly work practices, what kind of technology could help create peace of mind for parents who have to be away from their babies?

BabyBit is neither a higher tech baby monitor nor a medical device.  It’s a tool that provides insightful, actionable information, to both parent and caregiver so they can work together to keep baby safe and happy. The app has additional in-depth information a parent may want.

Specifications


Timeline



Choose Your Perks

WHY ARE WE CROWDFUNDING?

We know that there are millions of families out there that can benefit from BabyBit but we need your help to get it into the hands of the public. By taking part in this campaign, you will help us fund tooling and our first production run and you'll be the first to receive BabyBit. We can't wait to bring this product to market and we thank you in advance for your support! 

How We Will Use The Funds


The Team


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Even for long-time technologists, moving a product from concept to full production will have its challenges. BabyBit is no exception, as we've already navigated some unexpected hurdles and successfully handled a few surprises along the way. Our team has planned for multiple scenarios and chosen some of the most experienced partners out there to minimize potential risks. Other unanticipated issues may arise, but we intend to provide frequent, timely updates for our supporters and do everything to ensure that BabyBit is delivered on time. 

We have identified two risks we want to call out: 

Manufacturing

We need to ensure we can produce BabyBit at scale and deliver it on time to our customers. To this end, we have developed relationships with several manufacturers and logistics providers, both national and international, to allow us flexibility in choosing where and when to manufacture and how to ship to best meet customer demand. The final direction will be chosen based on the success of this campaign.

Range

BlueTooth LE has a range of over 70m (line of sight).  As with any wearable technology, buildings with thick walls or wire mesh in the walls can create problems with reception. 

FAQs

1. How does BabyBit work?

BabyBit is a wearable sensor that connects to the cloud and provides updates to your smartphone via our BabyBit app. You can be up and running in four easy steps:

  • Step 1: Parents and caregivers download the BabyBit app and configure notifications for events they would like to track (such as when a new caregiver takes over or the baby is sleeping on her stomach).
  • Step 2: Caregivers request permission from the parent (via the app) to connect to the baby's sensor.
  • Step 3: Clip the BabyBit sensor onto baby's clothing and ensure it connects to parents' and/or caregivers' phones.
  • Step 4: That's it. BabyBit will now continually monitor baby's environment and send notifications as needed. To get detailed, up to the minute information, parents can launch the app.

2. Will the app allow you to monitor more than one baby at a time?

Of course! You can track more than one baby at a time (each would require her own BabyBit), as a parent or caregiver. Furthermore, we're planning to build a daycare-focused solution for a future release.

3. When and where can I get one?

Currently, BabyBit is available only to our Indiegogo supporters. We plan to ship BabyBit to our supporters in November.

4. How much does it cost?

BabyBit will sell for $159 in retail. There is no additional expense for the first 2 years of usage.  After that, if you would like to continue using the notification service, there will be a $15 per year charge.  BabyBit will continue to work locally without the cloud service at no additional charge.

5. Can you tell if someone removes it from the baby?

Yes, BabyBit uses temperature and movement data to determine whether the sensor is attached to baby's clothing. Both the caregiver and the parent will be notified if the sensor is removed. 

6. Does BabyBit give you the baby's exact location?

BabyBit is not a tracking device.  Because the sensor is connected to the caregiver's phone, we can use the location of the phone to know where the baby is.  We provide a map with the location of the caregiver (only the parent phone can see this and only when a caregiver is connected to the baby) as well as the ability to setup notifications when the baby is at places you might want to be notified of such as the park, daycare or home.

7. Should I be concerned about putting BabyBit on my baby?

BabyBit uses an extremely low power networking technology (Bluetooth LE) that has been FDA-approved for medical devices, making it the lowest power, safest networking technology available for wearables and only a tiny fraction of the energy emitted by a cell phone or WiFi.  

8. Can it be hacked to listen in or get a video feed?

No device is completely safe from hackers. However, we have designed BabyBit to ensure the privacy of users to the greatest extent possible.  Data is analyzed locally and the sensor does not transfer audio or video, so nobody can get a feed or spy on your baby. All data is encrypted and only registered parents have access to the cloud data.

9. Has BabyBit been tested on real babies?

BabyBit has been worn by real babies and is continually being tested and improved.  We are currently on our third board design and have high confidence this version will be our production design. This BabyBit is being tested as we speak.

10. Why has Jaguar Land Rover invested in BabyBit?

We are thrilled to be part of the inaugural class of the Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) incubator. The partnership is moving BabyBit forward, particularly for capabilities related to car connectivity.

We, along with the JLR engineers have developed a prototype application that allows the vehicle to recognize when a baby has been left in the vehicle with no caregiver. The vehicle then turns on the HVAC system to keep the baby safe and comfortable and alerts the parent with location and temperature information.  If no one returns to the vehicle in a reasonable time or the vehicle gets too hot or cold, the vehicle can alert the authorities with the location of the baby. 

11. How does BabyBit attach to the baby's clothing? Can it work with any outfit?
BabyBit clips to any onesie or shirt with material thickness of  1/32" (a typical cotton onesie) up to 3/32" (a thicker flannel material) and will not damage the baby's clothing.

12. How long will the battery last?
BabyBit should last 3 days on a single charge.  It will send a notification to the caregiver and parent when it requires recharging (at about 25% charge remaining).

13. What happens if my baby puts BabyBit in her mouth?
As parents we know this is a "when" not an "if." We have designed BabyBit to be baby safe.  The materials are PVC, BPA, phthalate, lead and latex free, durable and FDA approved for skin contact.  It has also been tested to ensure it is not a choking hazard and it's dimensions exceed 1.25" on a side ensuring it will not pass through a choke tube.
story_txt:
“It's a pretty simple mechanism, but it’s one no other device has done.”David Priest  "There are 4 million babies born in the US every year, 
but what surprised us was that a million moms go back 
to work within two weeks of giving birth," Ostrovsky said.
 "Instead of being focused on inundating the parents with
 data, we're giving them the information they need when
 they need it so they can make decisions or feel better 
when can't be with their baby."Stuart Tomlinson As Seen On
We’ve reinvented the baby monitor with working parents in mind. BabyBit is a small wearable sensor you snap onto your baby’s clothing. It connects through your caregiver’s smartphone and sends you updates and notifications throughout the day about the things you want to know.


BabyBit was designed with one goal...to give new parents the information they need throughout the day when they can't be with their baby.




We use notifications to let parents know when something they
care about is happening. For example, when grandma picks up the baby from daycare mom
gets a notification. We felt that telling mom every time the baby cries
undercuts the caregiver and creates tension. Instead, mom sets the amount of time she wants to give the caregiver to attend to the baby and BabyBit only notifies her when that time is exceeded and she would want to get involved. 
We set up a series of these configurable notifications so parents can
choose what is important and what should cut through the noise of the day. The BabyBit app gives you additional detail when you want it.




“It’s Tuesday at 2 PM, where’s my baby?  With BabyBit I know…”  Katie G.


"I run a daycare from my home. I come highly
recommended in my area. It's not always an option for family and friends to
watch your children...first time
moms (I work for three of them) are nervous and I understand them wanting to
take every precaution. This product is a good idea."  Emily B.

















Our Story


Every parent has a story of a time they wish they knew what was
happening with their baby.  Our personal
experiences were part of what led us to develop BabyBit. Founder Brian recalls
a time when a babysitter planted his children in front of the TV and spent the
next four hours asleep in their guest bedroom. 
Co-founder Jonathan’s wife once came home to find a strange baby in their home.  It turned out that her nanny had
been leaving their infant unattended for 30 minutes each day so she could
pick-up another baby and care for them both in Jonathan’s home.  In both of these cases, a technology like
BabyBit would have notified the parent if the baby was crying for a long period
of time, and that the caregiver was not in proximity.  
Every year one million moms return to work within two weeks of
giving birth… With 9 children between us, the idea for BabyBit emerged when we
started to think about the stress new parents face, especially new mothers,
when they return to work – often much earlier than they would like.  We
asked ourselves, if we can't wave a wand and create more family friendly work practices,
what kind of technology could help create peace of mind for parents who have to
be away from their babies?
BabyBit is neither a higher tech baby monitor nor a medical
device.  It’s a tool that provides insightful, actionable information, to
both parent and caregiver so they can work together to keep baby safe and
happy. The app has additional in-depth information a parent may want.


Specifications










Timeline













Choose Your Perks

WHY ARE WE CROWDFUNDING?
We know that there are millions of families out there that can benefit from BabyBit but we need your help to get it into the hands of the public. By taking part in this campaign, you will help us fund tooling and our first production run and you'll be the first to receive BabyBit. We can't wait to bring this product to market and we thank you in advance for your support! 

How We Will Use The Funds





The Team












RISKS & CHALLENGES




Even for long-time technologists, moving a product from concept to full production will have its challenges. BabyBit is no exception, as we've already navigated some unexpected hurdles and successfully handled a few surprises along the way. Our team has planned for multiple scenarios and chosen some of the most experienced partners out there to minimize potential risks. Other unanticipated issues may arise, but we intend to provide frequent, timely updates for our supporters and do everything to ensure that BabyBit is delivered on time. 




We have identified two risks we want to call out: 



Manufacturing


We need to ensure we can produce BabyBit at scale and deliver it on time to our customers. To this end, we have developed relationships with several manufacturers and logistics providers, both national and international, to allow us flexibility in choosing where and when to manufacture and how to ship to best meet customer demand. The final direction will be chosen based on the success of this campaign.



Range


BlueTooth LE has a range of over 70m (line of sight).  As with any wearable technology, buildings with thick walls or wire mesh in the walls can create problems with reception. 


FAQs
